algorithm_technique: in-place modification with two passes: first for operations, second for shifting zeros
problem_summary_simple: Modify an array by doubling adjacent equal elements and zeroing the second, then move all zeros to the end.
problem_summary_technical: Applies operations by iterating through the array, doubling adjacent equal elements and zeroing the second. Then, uses a two-pointer approach to shift zeros to the end.
key_insights: The operations can be performed in-place by modifying the original array.
A two-pointer approach (or a similar single-pass scan) is efficient for moving zeros to the end.
The problem requires sequential application of operations, not simultaneous.
